snippet: The state has paid about $470,000 in management fees to Angelo Gordon & Company in the years that Mary Pat Christie has worked there, a vestige of an investment the state’s pension fund made before the governor took office.
abstract: International Business Times reports that New Jersey has $6.8 million in pension fund capital invested in hedge fund run by Angelo Gordon & Company, where Mary Pat Christie, wife of Gov Chris Christie, has been employed since 2012; state pays management fees for fund, but Christie administration officials say investments, made before he became governor, cannot be sold without significant impact on state taxpayers.
lead_paragraph: The state has paid about $470,000 in management fees to Angelo Gordon & Company in the years that Mary Pat Christie has worked there, a vestige of an investment the state’s pension fund made before the governor took office.

headline.main: New Jersey Paying Fees to a Financial Firm That Employs Christie’s Wife
